body_html: I played a bit with cuda fp16 ops - I'm not sure if its even useful to find such a threshold. The native fp16 op (i.e. hgemm) seems to be faster for larger square matrices only. Here exists a benchmark of hgemm on a P100. As this is currently the only card where implementing these ops is useful (the 10xx cards support the fp16 ops but only with a major decrease in performance), the fp16 ops are probably only interesting if future cuda/cudnn releases offer a speed up for computations on smaller matrices.
